meanings.definition: The amount of material or items passing through a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The thruputs of the factory increased after the new machinery was installed.
meanings.sent2: The thruputs of the conveyor belt determine the efficiency of the production line.
meanings.sent3: The thruputs of the assembly line decided to have a race to see who could pass through the system the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The thruputs of the river flowing through the valley never seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent5: The thruputs of the traffic jam were so high that cars barely moved.

meanings.definition: The rate at which data is processed or transferred.
meanings.sent1: The computer's thruputs were impressive, handling large amounts of data quickly.
meanings.sent2: The internet speed is determined by the thruputs of the network.
meanings.sent3: The thruputs of the email server decided to have a race to see who could process data the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The thruputs of information flowing through the system were like a fast-paced dance.
meanings.sent5: The thruputs of the download speed made the file transfer almost instant.

meanings.definition: The total output of a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The thruputs of the factory were measured at the end of each day.
meanings.sent2: The thruputs of the project were higher than expected, resulting in early completion.
meanings.sent3: The thruputs of the bakery decided to have a competition to see who could produce the most bread.
meanings.sent4: The thruputs of creativity in the artist's studio were overflowing.
meanings.sent5: The thruputs of the team's effort were evident in the final product.
